c74object.name: fl.chain~
c74object.digest: Schedules frames in the future at times specified times in the input frame
c74object.description: The output is an empty trigger frame. Inputs interact with previously scheduled frames according to time and mode parameters. The remaining count output can be used to track the number of currently scheduled frames.

entry.name: /units [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the time units used at the input.
[0] - samples[1] - ms[2] - seconds

entry.name: /time [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the way in which input values are interpreted:
[0] - absolute - times are interpreted as absolute values since the start of time.[1] - relative - times are interpreted as relative to the current reference time.[2] - interval - times are interpreted as intervals (deltas) relative to the current reference time.
Note that the reference time depends on the mode parameter.

entry.name: /mode [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the mode of operation:
[0] - replace - cancel previously scheduled frames before scheduling those in the input frame.[1] - add - add new frames to those already scheduled (even if before those already scheduled).[2] - append - schedule new frames only after those currently scheduled have completed.
Note that in replace and add modes the reference time is the time of the incoming frame. In append mode the reference time is that of the last currently scheduled frame. In append mode absolute times prior to the end of those already scheduled are ignored.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.chain~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: process
method.description:
Processes a non-realtime network, advancing time by the number of samples specified by the required length argument.
This will only take effect if the object has its rt attribute set to 0 More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

method.name: reset
method.description:
Resets a non-realtime network to the start of time ready for processing, optionally setting the sample rate. If the samplerate argument is omitted the network will be set to the global sample rate.
This will only take effect if fl.chain~ has its rt attribute set to 0. More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

method.name: signal
method.digest: Synchronise with audio or accept signal IO
method.description: Synchonises FrameLib objects with Max's audio processing.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: buffer
attribute.description:
Sets the non-realtime buffer~ for fl.chain~. This is the buffer~ used for IO in a non-realtime setting.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.chain~. When set to 0 fl.chain~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.chain~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
